oscal-profile-oscal-profile:profile.title: Profile
oscal-profile-oscal-profile:profile.description: Each OSCAL profile is defined by a Profile element

uuid.title: Profile Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this profile elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the profile can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).This identifier should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same profile across revisions of the document.

oscal-profile-oscal-profile:import.title: Import resource
oscal-profile-oscal-profile:import.description: The import designates a catalog or profile to be included (referenced and potentially modified) by this profile. The import also identifies which controls to select using the include-all, include-controls, and exclude-controls directives.

href.title: Catalog or Profile Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to the base catalog or profile that this profile is tailoring.

oscal-profile-oscal-profile:merge.title: Merge controls
oscal-profile-oscal-profile:merge.description: A Merge element provides structuring directives that drive how controls are organized after resolution.

combine.title: Combination rule
combine.description: A Combine element defines how to combine multiple (competing) versions of the same control.

method.title: Combination method
method.description: How clashing controls should be handled

as-is.title: As-Is Structuring Directive
as-is.description: An As-is element indicates that the controls should be structured in resolution as they are structured in their source catalogs. It does not contain any elements or attributes.

custom.title: Custom grouping
custom.description: A Custom element frames a structure for embedding represented controls in resolution.

oscal-profile-oscal-profile:group.title: Control group
oscal-profile-oscal-profile:group.description: A group of (selected) controls or of groups of controls

id.title: Group Identifier
id.description: A human-oriented, locally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this defined group elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. When referenced from another OSCAL instance, this identifier must be referenced in the context of the containing resource (e.g., import-profile). This id should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same group across revisions of the document.

class.title: Group Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the group.

title.title: Group Title
title.description: A name given to the group, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

oscal-profile-oscal-profile:modify.title: Modify controls
oscal-profile-oscal-profile:modify.description: Set parameters or amend controls in resolution

items.title: Parameter Setting
items.description: A parameter setting, to be propagated to points of insertion

param-id.title: Parameter ID
param-id.description: A human-oriented, locally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this defined parameter elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. When referenced from another OSCAL instance, this identifier must be referenced in the context of the containing resource (e.g., import-profile). This id should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

class.title: Parameter Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a characterization of the parameter.

depends-on.title: Depends on
depends-on.description: **(deprecated)** Another parameter invoking this one. This construct has been deprecated and should not be used.

label.title: Parameter Label
label.description: A short, placeholder name for the parameter, which can be used as a substitute for a value if no value is assigned.

usage.title: Parameter Usage Description
usage.description: Describes the purpose and use of a parameter

items.title: Alteration
items.description: An Alter element specifies changes to be made to an included control when a profile is resolved.

control-id.title: Control Identifier Reference
control-id.description: A human-oriented identifier reference to a control with a corresponding id value. When referencing an externally defined control, the Control Identifier Reference must be used in the context of the external / imported OSCAL instance (e.g., uri-reference).

items.title: Removal
items.description: Specifies objects to be removed from a control based on specific aspects of the object that must all match.

by-name.title: Reference by (assigned) name
by-name.description: Identify items to remove by matching their assigned name

by-class.title: Reference by class
by-class.description: Identify items to remove by matching their class.

by-id.title: Reference by ID
by-id.description: Identify items to remove indicated by their id.

by-item-name.title: Item Name Reference
by-item-name.description: Identify items to remove by the name of the item's information element name, e.g. title or prop

by-ns.title: Item Namespace Reference
by-ns.description: Identify items to remove by the item's ns, which is the namespace associated with a part, or prop.

items.title: Addition
items.description: Specifies contents to be added into controls, in resolution

position.title: Position
position.description: Where to add the new content with respect to the targeted element (beside it or inside it)

title.title: Title Change
title.description: A name given to the control, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

oscal-profile-oscal-profile:insert-contr.title: Select controls
oscal-profile-oscal-profile:insert-contr.description: Specifies which controls to use in the containing context.

order.title: Order
order.description: A designation of how a selection of controls in a profile is to be ordered.

oscal-profile-oscal-profile:select-contr.title: Call
oscal-profile-oscal-profile:select-contr.description: Call a control by its ID

with-child-controls.title: Include contained controls with control
with-child-controls.description: When a control is included, whether its child (dependent) controls are also included.

items.title: Match Controls by Pattern
items.description: Select controls by (regular expression) match on ID

pattern.title: Pattern
pattern.description: A glob expression matching the IDs of one or more controls to be selected.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:metadata.title: Publication metadata
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:metadata.description: Provides information about the publication and availability of the containing document.

title.title: Document Title
title.description: A name given to the document, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:revision.title: Revision History Entry
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:revision.description: An entry in a sequential list of revisions to the containing document in reverse chronological order (i.e., most recent previous revision first).

title.title: Document Title
title.description: A name given to the document revision, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:location.title: Location
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:location.description: A location, with associated metadata that can be referenced.

uuid.title: Location Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this defined location elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the location can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., from an importing OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Location Title
title.description: A name given to the location, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

items.title: Location URL
items.description: The uniform resource locator (URL) for a web site or Internet presence associated with the location.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:location-uu.title: Location Reference
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:location-uu.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to a location defined in the metadata section of this or another OSCAL instance. The UUID of the location in the source OSCAL instance is sufficient to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:party.title: Party (organization or person)
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:party.description: A responsible entity which is either a person or an organization.

uuid.title: Party Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this defined party elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. The locally defined UUID of the party can be used to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., from an importing OSCAL instance). This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

type.title: Party Type
type.description: A category describing the kind of party the object describes.

name.title: Party Name
name.description: The full name of the party. This is typically the legal name associated with the party.

short-name.title: Party Short Name
short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the party.

items.title: Party External Identifier
items.description: An identifier for a person or organization using a designated scheme. e.g. an Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID)

scheme.title: External Identifier Schema
scheme.description: Indicates the type of external identifier.

items.title: Organizational Affiliation
items.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to another party (person or organization) that this subject is associated with. The UUID of the party in the source OSCAL instance is sufficient to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:party-uuid.title: Party Reference
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:party-uuid.description: A machine-oriented identifier reference to another party defined in metadata. The UUID of the party in the source OSCAL instance is sufficient to reference the data item locally or globally (e.g., in an imported OSCAL instance).

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:role.title: Role
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:role.description: Defines a function assumed or expected to be assumed by a party in a specific situation.

id.title: Role Identifier
id.description: A human-oriented, locally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this defined role elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. When referenced from another OSCAL instance, the locally defined ID of the Role from the imported OSCAL instance must be referenced in the context of the containing resource (e.g., import, import-component-definition, import-profile, import-ssp or import-ap). This ID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Role Title
title.description: A name given to the role, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

short-name.title: Role Short Name
short-name.description: A short common name, abbreviation, or acronym for the role.

description.title: Role Description
description.description: A summary of the role's purpose and associated responsibilities.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:role-id.title: Role Identifier Reference
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:role-id.description: A human-oriented identifier reference to roles served by the user.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:back-matter.title: Back matter
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:back-matter.description: A collection of resources, which may be included directly or by reference.

items.title: Resource
items.description: A resource associated with content in the containing document. A resource may be directly included in the document base64 encoded or may point to one or more equivalent internet resources.

uuid.title: Resource Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this defined resource elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

title.title: Resource Title
title.description: A name given to the resource, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

description.title: Resource Description
description.description: A short summary of the resource used to indicate the purpose of the resource.

citation.title: Citation
citation.description: A citation consisting of end note text and optional structured bibliographic data.

items.title: Resource link
items.description: A pointer to an external resource with an optional hash for verification and change detection.

href.title: Hypertext Reference
href.description: A resolvable URI reference to a resource.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: Specifies a media type as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Media Types Registry.

base64.title: Base64
base64.description: The Base64 alphabet in RFC 2045 - aligned with XSD.

filename.title: File Name
filename.description: Name of the file before it was encoded as Base64 to be embedded in a resource. This is the name that will be assigned to the file when the file is decoded.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: Specifies a media type as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Media Types Registry.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:property.title: Property
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:property.description: An attribute, characteristic, or quality of the containing object expressed as a namespace qualified name/value pair. The value of a property is a simple scalar value, which may be expressed as a list of values.

name.title: Property Name
name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies a specific attribute, characteristic, or quality of the property's containing object.

uuid.title: Property Universally Unique Identifier
uuid.description: A machine-oriented, globally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this defined property elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. This UUID should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

ns.title: Property Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the property's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

value.title: Property Value
value.description: Indicates the value of the attribute, characteristic, or quality.

class.title: Property Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the property's name. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple properties of the same object with the same name and ns.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:link.title: Link
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:link.description: A reference to a local or remote resource

href.title: Hypertext Reference
href.description: A resolvable URL reference to a resource.

rel.title: Relation
rel.description: Describes the type of relationship provided by the link. This can be an indicator of the link's purpose.

media-type.title: Media Type
media-type.description: Specifies a media type as defined by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Media Types Registry.

text.title: Link Text
text.description: A textual label to associate with the link, which may be used for presentation in a tool.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:responsible.title: Responsible Party
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:responsible.description: A reference to a set of organizations or persons that have responsibility for performing a referenced role in the context of the containing object.

role-id.title: Responsible Role
role-id.description: A human-oriented identifier reference to roles served by the user.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:responsible.title: Responsible Role
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:responsible.description: A reference to one or more roles with responsibility for performing a function relative to the containing object.

role-id.title: Responsible Role ID
role-id.description: A human-oriented identifier reference to roles responsible for the business function.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:hash.title: Hash
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:hash.description: A representation of a cryptographic digest generated over a resource using a specified hash algorithm.

algorithm.title: Hash algorithm
algorithm.description: Method by which a hash is derived

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:remarks.title: Remarks
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:remarks.description: Additional commentary on the containing object.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:published.title: Publication Timestamp
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:published.description: The date and time the document was published. The date-time value must be formatted according to RFC 3339 with full time and time zone included.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:last-modifi.title: Last Modified Timestamp
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:last-modifi.description: The date and time the document was last modified. The date-time value must be formatted according to RFC 3339 with full time and time zone included.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:version.title: Document Version
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:version.description: A string used to distinguish the current version of the document from other previous (and future) versions.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:oscal-versi.title: OSCAL version
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:oscal-versi.description: The OSCAL model version the document was authored against.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:email-addre.title: Email Address
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:email-addre.description: An email address as defined by RFC 5322 Section 3.4.1.

type.title: type flag
type.description: Indicates the type of phone number.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:address.title: Address
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:address.description: A postal address for the location.

city.title: City
city.description: City, town or geographical region for the mailing address.

state.title: State
state.description: State, province or analogous geographical region for mailing address

postal-code.title: Postal Code
postal-code.description: Postal or ZIP code for mailing address

country.title: Country Code
country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the mailing address.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:addr-line.title: Address line
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:addr-line.description: A single line of an address.

oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:document-id.title: Document Identifier
oscal-profile-oscal-metadata:document-id.description: A document identifier qualified by an identifier scheme. A document identifier provides a globally unique identifier with a cross-instance scope that is used for a group of documents that are to be treated as different versions of the same document. If this element does not appear, or if the value of this element is empty, the value of "document-id" is equal to the value of the "uuid" flag of the top-level root element.

scheme.title: Document Identification Scheme
scheme.description: Qualifies the kind of document identifier using a URI. If the scheme is not provided the value of the element will be interpreted as a string of characters.

oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:part.title: Part
oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:part.description: A partition of a control's definition or a child of another part.

id.title: Part Identifier
id.description: A human-oriented, locally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this defined part elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. When referenced from another OSCAL instance, this identifier must be referenced in the context of the containing resource (e.g., import-profile). This id should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

name.title: Part Name
name.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type.

ns.title: Part Namespace
ns.description: A namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

class.title: Part Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the part's name. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple parts of the same control with the same name and ns.

title.title: Part Title
title.description: A name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

prose.title: Part Text
prose.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:param.title: Parameter
oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:param.description: Parameters provide a mechanism for the dynamic assignment of value(s) in a control.

id.title: Parameter Identifier
id.description: A human-oriented, locally unique identifier with cross-instance scope that can be used to reference this defined parameter elsewhere in this or other OSCAL instances. When referenced from another OSCAL instance, this identifier must be referenced in the context of the containing resource (e.g., import-profile). This id should be assigned per-subject, which means it should be consistently used to identify the same subject across revisions of the document.

class.title: Parameter Class
class.description: A textual label that provides a characterization of the parameter.

depends-on.title: Depends on
depends-on.description: **(deprecated)** Another parameter invoking this one. This construct has been deprecated and should not be used.

label.title: Parameter Label
label.description: A short, placeholder name for the parameter, which can be used as a substitute for a value if no value is assigned.

usage.title: Parameter Usage Description
usage.description: Describes the purpose and use of a parameter

oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:param.title: Constraint
oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:param.description: A formal or informal expression of a constraint or test

description.title: Constraint Description
description.description: A textual summary of the constraint to be applied.

items.title: Constraint Test
items.description: A test expression which is expected to be evaluated by a tool.

expression.title: Constraint test
expression.description: A formal (executable) expression of a constraint

oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:param.title: Guideline
oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:param.description: A prose statement that provides a recommendation for the use of a parameter.

prose.title: Guideline Text
prose.description: Prose permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:param.title: Parameter Value
oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:param.description: A parameter value or set of values.

how-many.title: Parameter Cardinality
how-many.description: Describes the number of selections that must occur. Without this setting, only one value should be assumed to be permitted.

items.title: Choice
items.description: A value selection among several such options

oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:inclu.title: Include All
oscal-profile-oscal-catalog-common:inclu.description: Include all controls from the imported catalog or profile resources.

UUIDDatatype.description: A type 4 ('random' or 'pseudorandom') or type 5 UUID per RFC 4122.
